page.title: 11WORCESTERSHIRE LIFE (SQ.12)
page.content: Of the 18 houses in the square most are old red brick, one older house is timber framed in part with white plaster (wattle & daub?). Six semi-datached houses in a row, originally built for farm workers but now occupied by commuters. Hedges are fairly high: mostly hawthorn interspersed with the odd holly. Some contain the trees of the {Perry Pear}now apparently no longer gathered for this purpose. Trees are grouped together, with the odd one here and there in the hedgerow; oak and ash predominate. Plenty of blackbirds, thrushes, wood pigeon sparrows and starlings are present. {No weedkiller}appears to have been used and the grass beneath the hedges is high, thus enabling voles etc. to live.
